question_text: What physical and logical layer characteristics distinguish DSL from cable service?
answer_options: DSL uses fiber; cable uses coax
DSL is shared-bandwidth; cable is point-to-point
DSL is point-to-point; cable uses shared coax infrastructure
Both DSL and cable are point-to-point systems
correct_answer: DSL is point-to-point; cable uses shared coax infrastructure
explanation: DSL is a direct line to the central office, while cable modems share coax bandwidth with neighbors, affecting performance.
